thread.title: Operation of meth lab could mean life in prison
thread.title_full: Operation of meth lab could mean life in prison - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Christie Walton
title: Operation of meth lab could mean life in prison
text:
FRANKLINTON, LA (WVUE) - A Washington Parish jury convicted Glen Guyn, 49, of Mount Hermon on charges he was cooking methamphetamine to sell.
He faces 30 years to life in prison when District Judge Richard A. Swartz passes sentence in December.
The case began when task force officers stopped Guyn for driving erratically.
When officers searched the vehicle they found baggies of methamphetamine powder. A later search of his home revealed the items used to produce the drug.
A news release from the Washington Parish District Attorney describes Guyn as a multiple felony offender. He pleaded guilty to armed robbery in 1989 and had a number of prior drug dealing convictions.
